2Q25: Slower growth arising competition; VBP remains an overhang remain Uw

MPEP reported 1H25 results with revenue and net profit up \(13\%\) and \(92\%\) YoY, respectively, to RMB224mn and RMB33mn. Notably, in 2Q25, both sales and net profit showed slower growth of \(10\%\) and \(15\%\) YoY, versus \(17\%\) and \(329\%\) YoY growth in 1Q25, respectively. While the company continues to expand overseas with regional growth and new approvals, we observe that its China business remains under pressure due to rising competition. For example, its PFA (pulsed field ablation) products are late entrants to the market, and need significant efforts to win over competitors. As a result, we reduce our earnings forecast for 25- 27E by \(1 - 2\%\) . Consequently, we lower our price target from RMB11.2 to RMB11.0. We maintain an Underweight rating for MPEP amid rising competition and VBP uncertainty in the electrophysiology space, which does not justify its 26E/27E PE ratios of \(\sim 110x / 80x\) .

- 2Q25 saw slower growth in top line and bottom line vs 1Q25 with 2Q25 profit down QoQ. MPEP reported 2Q25 sales/net profit of RMB120m/RMB15m, up \(10\% /15\%\) was slower than \(17\% /329\%\) in 1Q25. Recurring net profit reached RMB8mn, higher than RMB2mn in 2Q24 but lower than RMB13mn in 1Q25. Operational efficiency improvement was on track with GPM ratio growing 2ppt and OPEX ratio being down 2ppt, but the decline in the R&D expense ratio was helped by capitalized R&D expense during the quarter.

- Product and pipeline execution progressed across "ice/fire/electric/magnetic," supporting the full-procedure EP solution framework. On "fire", the TrueForce pressure-sensing, magnetic-tracking RF ablation catheter (double-curve) obtained approval in 1H25. Management indicated there were \(>3,000\) domestic surgeries using pressure-sensing catheters in 1H25 and there could be \(\sim 7,000\) such surgeries in full-year 2025, with roughly one-third used in A-Fib treatment; overseas substitution rates were described as higher. On "electric", the PFA system and catheter of ShangYang (an associate company) obtained NMPA approval and is in commercialization, while the company's pressure PFA catheter is under review, targeting 2025 approval; the "Gen-2" nanosecond, one-shot concept solution has completed patient enrollment and entered follow-up. On "ice," the cryo suite received CE marking approval with training and early commercialization underway in Europe.

- Commercially, the overseas business outperformed in 1H25 while domestic operations centered on A-Fib penetration and hospital admissions for newer products. Management cited 1H25 overseas revenue growth of \(40\% +\) and overseas revenue contribution is \(\sim 31\%\) of total revenue, but FY25E full-year overseas growth guidance remains at \(30\% +\) , suggesting potential lower growth in 2H25. In the longer-term revenue contributed from

P/E220.0175.4131.199.1

MPEP offers a wide range of surgical products for cardiac ablation, a minimally invasive surgery in electrophysiology (EP) for treating an irregular heartbeat. Its share price once surged \(100\% +\) back in 3Q22, as the initial VBP price cut on EP products was the lowest \((- 49\%)\) amongst VBP product categories. Given MPEP's share price is still \(\sim 40\%\) above pre- VBP levels, we think the market is pricing in a scenario where MPEP would further gain market share and/or see a price increment in the upcoming VBP renewal round, which we believe is unlikely given MPEP was already the major winner in the initial VBP round. Consensus earnings cannot explain the premium either, as it is trading at \(\sim 140\times 100x\) its 25E/26E consensus earnings and 3x PEG, which topped the sector. Hence, we see a P/E derating risk for MPEP if VBP contract renewal and market share expansion does not meet expectations. Moreover, in the longer term, we are also cautious about the potential competition from APT Medical, its primary rival recently acquired by resource- rich medtech giant Mindray.

Our Jun- 26 PT of Rmb11.2 is derived from DCF analysis, where we assume a WACC of \(8.5\%\) and a terminal growth rate of \(3.0\%\) . This reflects our view on the risk- adjusted sales potential of the company's portfolio of assets.

overseas market could reach around 50%, according to management. In China, the 3D EP footprint covers 1,000+ hospitals with exact cumulative procedures; management referenced ~10k domestic 3D surgeries done in 1H25 and ~30% was through TrueForce catheter within 3D EP surgeries. On VBP, while management noted Fujian renewal round timing is unclear and Sichuan is initiating a new round of VBP in August,there is no news about a national level VBP at sight yet.

**·Management outlined near-term growth drivers and medium-term pipeline** **milestones without changing previously communicated targets.** Near term, pressure catheter penetration and overseas expansion are expected to contribute significantly;medium term, PFA and RDN (renal denervation, company targeting 2026 China approval) are positioned as additional growth vectors, with ICE and other high-end consumables broadening the portfolio. The company is adding clinical support and commercial staff for anticipated PFA needs and continues cost control measures.

**·Items to monitor include:** domestic VBP and price-cut results roll-outs, hospital admission cadence for new products, progress in higher-bar overseas registrations,competitive and evidence developments in PFA/RDN, and execution in clinical support capacity and channel expansion.
Figure 1: MPEP Financial Summary

MicroPort EP - A (Underweight; Price Target: Rmb11.00)

MPEP offers a wide range of surgical products for cardiac ablation, a minimally invasive surgery in electrophysiology (EP) for treating an irregular heartbeat. Its share price once surged \(100\% +\) back in 3Q22, as the initial VBP price cut on EP products was the lowest \((- 49\%)\) amongst VBP product categories. Given MPEP's share price is still \(\sim 40\%\) above pre- VBP levels, we think the market is pricing in the scenario where MPEP would further gain market share and/or see a price increment in the upcoming VBP renewal round, which we believe is unlikely given MPEP was already the major winner in the initial VBP round. Consensus earnings can not explain the premium either, as it is trading at \(\sim 140x / 100x\) its 25E/26E consensus earnings and \(3x\) PEG, which topped the sector. Hence, we see a P/E derating risk for MPEP if VBP contract renewal and market share expansion does not meet expectations. Moreover, in the longer term, we are also cautious about the potential competition from APT Medical, its primary rival recently acquired by resource- rich medtech giant Mindray.

Our Jun- 26 PT of Rmb11.2 is derived from DCF analysis, where we assume a WACC of \(8.5\%\) and a terminal growth rate of \(3.0\%\) . This reflects our view on the risk- adjusted sales potential of the company's portfolio of assets.
